conclusion: Work done by or on the gas is given by the area under the curve on the P-V diagram.
Process C → A is a horizontal line on the P-V diagram indicating constant pressure.
Pressure at C → A is 1 × 10⁵ Pa.
Volume at point C is 5 L and at point A is 2 L.
Change in volume during C → A is -3 L.
Work done by the external environment during a constant-pressure process is W = -P ΔV.
Substitute values into the formula: W = -(1 × 10⁵) × (-3 × 10⁻³).
Simplify the calculation to get W = 300 J.
Positive value of W = 300 J indicates 300 J of work is done by the external environment on the gas during C → A.
The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process C → A is 300 J.
